objective.title: Team Task Management Application
objective.summary: Develop a modern web application enabling small development teams to collaborate effectively on projects, featuring real-time updates, Kanban boards, and comprehensive task management functionalities.
objective.intent: To provide a user-friendly and efficient task management solution for small development teams, fostering collaboration and improving project organization.
objective.context: Small development teams (5-20 people) require a centralized platform for task assignment, tracking progress, and facilitating communication. Existing solutions often lack the specific features or scalability needed by these smaller groups.

requirements.description: Kanban board view with drag-and-drop functionality
Support for due dates, priorities, and labels on tasks
File attachment and commenting capabilities for tasks
Mobile-responsive design for accessibility across devices
REQ-007: Task assignment and role-based permissions (e.g., admin, member, guest).  Currently, task assignment is implied but not explicitly stated. Permissions are critical for team management.
REQ-008: Search and filtering capabilities for tasks and projects.  Essential for usability as teams and projects grow.
REQ-009: Reporting and analytics on project progress and team performance. Provides valuable insights for improvement.
REQ-010: Notification system (e.g., email, in-app) for task updates and assignments.  Crucial for timely awareness.
REQ-011: API for potential integrations with other tools (e.g., Slack, Jira).  Increases long-term value and extensibility.

constraints.description: Target user base: Small development teams (5-20 people)

success_criteria.description: User authentication successfully implemented with OAuth providers
Kanban board functionality allows for seamless task movement and organization
Application is accessible and functional on various mobile devices

description.description: MVP delivered within 4 weeks, adhering to scope and budget.  (Added adherence to scope and budget)
User authentication successfully implemented with OAuth providers, achieving a 99.9% authentication success rate. (Added quantifiable metric)
Kanban board functionality allows for seamless task movement and organization, with an average task movement time of under 1 second. (Added quantifiable metric and clarified 'seamless')

Application is accessible and functional on various mobile devices (iOS and Android) with a minimum screen resolution of 320x480, achieving a PageSpeed Insights score of 80 or higher. (Added specific devices, resolution, and performance metric)
80% of target user group (small development teams) report satisfaction with the application's usability after a one-hour training session. (Added user acceptance criteria and training element)

refinement_notes.analysis: The objective provides a reasonable starting point for a team task management application. However, several areas require clarification and expansion to ensure a successful outcome. The requirements are somewhat high-level and lack specificity. Constraints are well-defined technically but lack business and operational constraints. Success criteria are present but lack quantifiable metrics and specific user acceptance criteria. The 'seamless' and 'accessible and functional' descriptions are subjective and need to be defined more precisely.

recommendations: Conduct user research with representative small development teams to validate requirements and identify unmet needs. This will help prioritize features and ensure the application addresses real-world pain points.

Define a clear scope for the MVP.  The current requirements are extensive and may be difficult to deliver within 4 weeks. Prioritize 'must-have' features and defer less critical features to future iterations.
Establish a robust testing plan, including unit, integration, and user acceptance testing, to ensure quality and identify potential issues early on.
Consider adding a 'security' constraint outlining specific security requirements and protocols to be followed throughout the development process.
Define a clear process for gathering and incorporating user feedback post-launch to ensure continuous improvement and alignment with user needs.
Add a constraint regarding data retention and privacy compliance (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) to ensure legal and ethical considerations are addressed.
